content.question: According to the quantity theory of money, if a <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> percent increase in the money supply leads to a <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> percent increase in nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is true?

choices.label: Real output increases by <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> percent.
The price level decreases by <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> percent.
The velocity of money does not change.
The nominal interest rate does not change.
The government budget deficit increases by <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> percent.

content.answer: The velocity of money does not change.
